intro: Tuberaria variabilis subsp. eriocaulon, commonly known as the woolly tuberaria, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves, which are often covered in a fine, woolly coating. It produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. This subspecies is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient and drought-tolerant species.
